name: df-sgn
body: |- wceq(csgn, cmpt(s0, cxr, cif(nat0, cif(cneg(nat1), nat1, wbr(cv(s0), clt, nat0)), wceq(cv(s0), nat0))))
comment: Signum function. We do not call it "sign", which is homophonic with "sine" ( ~ df-sin ). Defined as "sgn" in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-9.13. It is named "sign" (with the same definition) in the "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" , front introduction, "Common Notations and Definitions" section at ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/front/introduction#Sx4 . We define this over ` RR* ` ( ~ df-xr ) instead of ` RR ` so that it can accept ` +oo ` and ` -oo ` . Note that ~ df-psgn defines the sign of a permutation, which is different. Value shown in ~ sgnval . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)
